pt.iul.poo.image

Class SimpleImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.iul.poo.image.SimpleImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<DisplayableElement>, DisplayableElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MovingImage, TemporaryImage

    public class SimpleImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, DisplayableElement
    Simple image is a wrapper for a BufferedImage that contains a position in a cartesian coordinate system (origin at the top left corner of the image).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleImage(java.lang.String fileName, int x, int y)
      Creates an image that will be displayed in the (x,y) coordinate when sent to a display window.
      SimpleImage(java.lang.String fileName, int x, int y, int priority)
      Creates an image that will be displayed in the (x,y) coordinate when sent to a display window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleImage

        public SimpleImage(java.lang.String fileName,
           int x,
           int y)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an image that will be displayed in the (x,y) coordinate when sent to a display window.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Image file
        x - x axis coordinate for the top left corner of the image when displayed
        y - y axis coordinate for the top left corner of the image when displayed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • SimpleImage

        public SimpleImage(java.lang.String fileName,
           int x,
           int y,
           int priority)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an image that will be displayed in the (x,y) coordinate when sent to a display window.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Image file
        x - x axis coordinate for the top left corner of the image when displayed
        y - y axis coordinate for the top left corner of the image when displayed
        priority - controls the priority of the image, images with higher priority can superimpose images with lower priority
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
